did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box/folder, Richmond First Club records, M 238, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond, Virginia

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by the Richmond First Club in several accessions between 1987 and 2016.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Bulletins are arranged by date. Duplicates have been weeded from the collection and either returned to the Richmond First Club or disposed of. Photographs, video tapes and audio cassette tapes have been transferred to RG 60, 70 and M 15 respectively. The oversized materials are maps of the Richmond area of the 1980s.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Organized in 1919, the Richmond First Club (RFC) was founded by Dr. Dice R. Anderson and B. Roy Dudley, Jr. to continue the work begun by the Richmond Civic Association. Strictly non-partisan and closed to employees and officials of the city, the RFC engages in objective studies of the city's government and offers suggestions for improvements. A more specific history can be found in "A Seventy-Five Year Participation in Local Government: Richmond-First Club 1919-1994" by John H. Whaley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Richmond First Club Papers consist of administrative files, correspondence, reports, memoranda, committee files, publications, audio tapes, photographs and clippings about the Club's activities or interests. The materials encompass the years 1919-1990, but are concentrated in the period from the mid 1970s through the present. Series 8 contains photocopied material from the Raymond Pinchbeck Papers at the Virginia Baptist Historical Society. The bulk of these materials are dated from the 1950s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The majority of the files are arranged alphabetically, thereunder chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Includes three editions of Hanover Living Guide and a Copy of the Richmond Business Journal December 1986. Also included are maps of Chesterfield County, Goochland County and Henrico County.
